org.fraunhofer.jhmi.util

Class ConnectionOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fraunhofer.jhmi.util.ConnectionOptions

  • public class ConnectionOptions
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConnectionOptions()
      Creates the default ConnectionOptions with autoConnect and CleanSession set to true keepAlive = 30 connectionTimeout = 60 maxInflight = 10 qos = 2.
      ConnectionOptions(char[] password, java.lang.String username)
      Creates the default ConnectionOptions with autoConnect and CleanSession set to true keepAlive = 30 connectionTimeout = 60 maxInflight = 10 qos = 2.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionOptions

        public ConnectionOptions()
        Creates the default ConnectionOptions with autoConnect and CleanSession set to true keepAlive = 30 connectionTimeout = 60 maxInflight = 10 qos = 2.

      • ConnectionOptions

        public ConnectionOptions(char[] password,
                         java.lang.String username)
        Creates the default ConnectionOptions with autoConnect and CleanSession set to true keepAlive = 30 connectionTimeout = 60 maxInflight = 10 qos = 2. Also set's the specified password and username for authentification
        Parameters:
        password - The password for the authentification
        username - The username for the authentification

    • Method Detail

      • unstableNetworkOptions

        public void unstableNetworkOptions()
        Set's keepAlive to 45 and connectionTimeout to 90 and maxInflight to 7

      • stableNetworkOptions

        public void stableNetworkOptions()
        Set's keepAlive to 15 and connectionTimeout to 30 and maxInflight to 15

      • setKeepAlive

        public void setKeepAlive(int newKeepAlive)
        Specifies a new value for keepAlive value
        Parameters:
        newKeepAlive - Determines the time in seconds that the client will wait to establish it's connection to the broker. By default this value is 30 Seconds.

      • getKeepAlive

        public int getKeepAlive()
        Get the specified value for keepAlive. Determines the time in seconds that the client will wait to establish it's connection to the broker. By default this value is 30 Seconds.
        Returns:
        The specified keepAlive value.

      • setAutoReconnect

        public void setAutoReconnect(java.lang.Boolean newAutoReconnect)
        Specifies a new value for autoReconnect value.
        Parameters:
        newAutoReconnect - Determines if the client should automatically reconnect to the broker if connection was cut. By default this is set to true.

      • getAutoReconnect

        public java.lang.Boolean getAutoReconnect()
        Get the specified value for autoReconnect. Determines if the client should automatically reconnect to the broker if connection was cut. By default this is set to true.
        Returns:
        The specified value for autoReconnect.

      • setCleanSession

        public void setCleanSession(java.lang.Boolean newCleanSession)
        Specifies a new value for cleanSession.
        Parameters:
        newCleanSession - Determines if the client should remember it's state between reconnects. By default this is set to true.

      • getCleanSession

        public java.lang.Boolean getCleanSession()
        Get the specified value for cleanSession. Determines if the client should remember it's state between reconnects. By default this is set to true.
        Returns:
        The specified cleanSession value.

      • setConnectionTimeout

        public void setConnectionTimeout(int newConnectionTimeout)
        Specifies a new value for connectionTimeout
        Parameters:
        newConnectionTimeout - Determines the maximum time between messages that the client uses to determine if the server is still available. This can be either a message received or a message sent. The client will sent a "ping" message if no messages had to be received or sent within this time frame. By default this value is set to 60

      • getConnectionTimeout

        public int getConnectionTimeout()
        Get the specified value for connectionTimeout Determines the maximum time between messages that the client uses to determine if the server is still available. This can be either a message received or a message sent. The client will sent a "ping" message if no messages had to be received or sent within this time frame. By default this value is set to 60
        Returns:
        The specified connectionTimeout value.

      • setMaxInflight

        public void setMaxInflight(int newMaxInflight)
        Specifies a new value for maxInflight.
        Parameters:
        newMaxInflight - Determines the maximum number of messages that can be "inflight" at the same time in relation to this client. A message is "inflight" if it is sent but it's arrival has not yet been acknowledged. By default this value is set to 10.

      • getMaxInflight

        public int getMaxInflight()
        Get the specified value for maxInflight. Determines the maximum number of messages that can be "inflight" at the same time in relation to this client. A message is "inflight" if it is sent but it's arrival has not yet been acknowledged. By default this value is set to 10.
        Returns:
        The value for MaxInflight.

                        java.lang.String newLastWillTopic)

        Parameters:

      • getClientType

        public ClientType getClientType()
        Get the specified clientType The type of client you want to create. For more Information towards specific clients, please refer to the Javadoc of the ClientType Enum and it's individual Types.
        Returns:
        The specified clientType

      • setClientType

        public void setClientType(ClientType clientType)
        Specifies a new clientType.
        Parameters:
        clientType - The type of client you want to create. For more Information towards specific clients, please refer to the Javadoc of the ClientType Enum and it's individual Types.

      • getQos

        public int getQos()
        Get the specified qos. The quality of service for the message that should be used. 0 for lowest and 2 for highest. 2 guarantees delivery if the broker is available but costs more resources. 1 guarantees delivery but can create more network traffic. 0 does not guarantee delivery.
        Returns:
        The specified qos

      • setQos

        public void setQos(int qos)
        Specifies a new value for qos.
        Parameters:
        qos - The quality of service for the message that should be used. 0 for lowest and 2 for highest. 2 guarantees delivery if the broker is available but costs more resources. 1 guarantees delivery but can create more network traffic. 0 does not guarantee delivery.
